Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as expected”
Reviews.Author: Sloff
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this hotel (through another site) as we were meeting up with uni friends in London for the weekend. I have to say after reading some of the other reviews on here I was highly skeptical about what our stay was going to be like, but was pleasantly surprised. Location is brilliant, not far from tube and within walking distance of Hyde Park. We must have had a refurbished room, beds were comfy the shower worked and noise levels were negligible for a city. For the price of the room and somewhere to kip down for a night this place was ideal. Didn't get up for breakfast as it was continental and had a heavy night before!

Reviews.Title: “WE STRONGLY ADVISE NOT TO GO HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Joey V
Reviews.Content: Our room had just been painted and the tape was still on the walls and door. Paint chips were all over the floor and bed(!) and the room had clearly not been cleaned. The toilet was covered in urine stains and the mattress had a one square meter area where the filling completely missed. The unfriendly receptionist seemed ignorant on our complaints and we decided not to stay. We even explicitly told the receptionist they could keep the down payment, but we would not be staying due to the abovementioned reasons. A few weeks later we found out the hotel still charged to full stay to our credit card, since their terms of agreement states that the hotel can decide whether or not they charge. Again, safe yourself from a bad experience in London and do not stay in this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy but clean room”
Reviews.Author: Grapet01
Reviews.Content: Booked 4 nights this week, and had the first one last night. The room was clean although the staircase and corridors are dusty and stained. Several small 'fist'holes in the walls added to the disturbed ambience of the place. Extremely noisy room with barking neighbours and a bus stop outside the window. Perhaps other rooms would be quieter. On the positive side the room and bed was clean, with freeview flatscreen TV, toilet was fine, so not too bad for a budget hotel. The hilton next door was 10x the cost.. go figure.

Reviews.Title: “Such a terrible experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: tiagobalsini
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel by internet for the good price and suppose to be 3 star, but this was a big big mistake! This hotel cannot have even 1 star. Any hostel in London is better then this dirty, noise and NOT friendly staff. The carpet is DIRTY, the rooms are small and dirty, the bed sheets are smelling, the breaksfeast is a JOKE! So..I can just say one think about this hotel: Was the worsth, dirty, noise and terrible hotel I had in all my life travelling in all the world. I don t recommend for anyone who goes to London stay there. The only good thing there is the location, that s it!

Reviews.Title: “Ewwww”
Reviews.Author: superssonic
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by workmen making the reception area look all nice. Shame they didnt do up the room. The carpet was filthy and ripped the bed had some nice stains on it. The plug socket was burnt out and the light switches just worked random lights,never the same one at each press. The place was a maze and what looked like a building site in one part. I slept fulled clothed incase i caught anything from the bed. Then i tried to get some hot water from the tap and the tap just came off in my hand. I aksed in reception whats going and and he said water in 5 mins no worry no worry. The bathroom was had cracked tiles and the shower was nasty. Only stay here is you are desperate.

Reviews.Title: “there is a catch.”
Reviews.Author: flying f
Reviews.Content: if you're like me you probably looked at the lovely picture of the facade and was impressed by the price and the location. this hotel... is a disgrace. the hallways smell toxic, because some amateur painter has been painting it recently, the shower is clogged so that obviously flooded. the shower was also ridiculosuly small, i have never had such a cramped shower. i felt like houdini in a water tank. so i recently quit drinking until i checked in here, i realized there was no way i could do this sober. so cheers to that. it wouldnt be so bad if it was this room on a ship, as in a cabin. but i have to make a three point turn just to take a dump. the reception was a gangsta madafaka in a leather jacket not even bothering to look at my passport. yeah.. so counting hours to get out of here. also it says wifi, but that actually costs 2.50$ an hour.. YEAH I KNOW. paddington as an area is not good, I would advise you to stay somewhere else. there's just a lot of lebanese and arabic places around and u cant even get free wifi at a pub. only good thing was the run around hyde park, because of the proximity.. but id start my run on the other side of hyde park if i were u. this is not worth it, pay 5-6£ extra and it will well be worth it. i promise. window is also too small for me to fit through it and end this experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a con trick”
Reviews.Author: walesjme
Reviews.Content: Rooms dirty! Doors unlockable! Communications terrible! What a disgrace and a con exercise!!! Why did I not check the reviews before inflicting this on my family and saved myself a lot of grief. Lesson learned, keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: gemma z
Reviews.Content: this hotel was not great. but I liked the location and for the price in London..Fair enough.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Andrew H
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL!!!!!!!!! The management have a total disregard for safety: ALL fire exits were completely blocked, electric sockets in room defective - one was actually broken in half with full finger access to the live wire! Room was not as described in TravelStay.com description - no plasma screen tv or DVD player. Was told wrong times for breakfast and so ended up missing it completely. When I approached the management about the obvious safety issues they were not interested at all and made no effort to unblock fire exits. As it was so late I had no option but to stay in the hotel and ended up having to clear the fire exit myself by removing heavy bags of builders rubble and old beds. I suggest TravelStay.com disassociate themselves from this "hotel". I am passing on all my photographic and video evidence to the Health and Safety Executive, Local Authority, and Fire Service.

Reviews.Title: “!!! DONT STAY HERE THEY SHOULD BE SHUT DOWN !!!!”
Reviews.Author: darren b
Reviews.Content: well we stayed here on new years eve in a triple room ( well i think it may of been a single room with a double and a single in it) i only went into the hotel (squat) to ask for directions to the car park and thought omg what have we booked here it doent even have a good looking front desk or anything but gave it the benefit of the dought. on the site it states SATELLITE TV, there wasnt any satellite tv and the tv we did have was broken . HAIR DRYER, didnt work LIFT, that actually only goes to the 4th floor and we were on the 5th all tho it does give u breakfast and the offer of room service i wouldnt even want to touch anything that came out of their kitchen !!! are room was diabolical it was the smallest room i have even seen for 3 people and: the tv didnt work hardley any of the lights worked the plug socket didnt really work unless u hit it hairdryer didnt work the actuall door to the room didnt fit properly the carpet lifted up when u opened the door towel rail in bathroom kept falling off bath was discusting shower attacthment broken no hot water unless u ran it for 30 mins before no water pressure keeps coming and going very lucky to even get to have a shower bathroom door fell off its hinges the window ledges were that rotten im surprised the window is still in the hole when we got to the hotel i decided to take the staires rather than wait for the lift there was holes everywhere in the walls there was piles of wood rubbish on landings there was a pillow case on the 3rd floor landing and when we left it was still there. u can tell that the people who run this hotel dont care about any of thier customers (i did notice a lot of the people who stay here are forein and i think this is how they r still carrying on to rip people off i only stayed the night but other people must of been staying for a week or so as they had so much luggage with them ) the only good things about this hotel is that the bed linen was clean and it is across the road from paddington tube station THIS IS WITH OUT A DOUGHT THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN !! PLEASE PLEASE DO NOT DO IT TO YOURSELF .. THE ONLY THING THIS HOTEL REMINDS ME OF IS A DIRTY OLD BROTHEL OFF A HORROR FILM.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay if you plan to be blind drunk for your entire stay”
Reviews.Author: Hannah_5000
Reviews.Content: I think if a safety inspector visited this hotel they would shut it down. Pretty much all the fixtures and fittings are missing from this room. Had to wait 20 mins for the shower to warm up. There was only one plug socket which I gave to my boyfriend to charge his phone up with so started my day with a dead phone. felt really unsafe in the room. Oh and you probably don't even need to bother paying. My boyfriend checked in earlier on in the day and I went there for the first time on my own to put my stuff down. Asked the reception for a key to 500 and he didn't even question me or ask for Id. He just handed the key straight over so don't expect your stuff to be safe!

Reviews.Title: “Never ever stay here !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christian S
Reviews.Content: Before you consider booking this hotel, sit down and take a minute, give yourself a good talking to. This hotel is twinned with Beckton sewage plant, do not stay here at any cost, you are better off wondering down the road to the tube station and hang out with the local homeless people waiting for there weekly methodone shot from St Mary's hospital. The worst place I have ever stayed in, even the Mercreede down the Romford Road beats this one,

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for the budget concious traveller - not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: StephenCYW
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ascot Hyde Sunday November 13th for one night as we were meeting up with a friend for the evening in London. I chose the site due to reasonable price ($65 pounds) and good location to the Paddinton train and subway. It was a very short walk from both which makes it covenient if you have luggage with you and use the rails as your main tranportation. Check in was easy as I had booked on Expedia, so things were done quickly. Desk agent was friendly and helpful. Our requested wake up call was right on time. The exterior of the hotel looks fair, though the interior is quite another story. It has been well used and in need of a good over-haul, though this would mean a fair increase in price needed to be charged. There are not many things in London that would be considered cheap, and what qualifies does so for a reason. Rooms are quite small, beds are well broken in, and the bathroom is bare basics. They do have a restaraunt on site though I did not use it so cannot comment. I'd likely choose a different option if I find myself in need once again, though could see it being a reasonble choice for some trying not to break the bank in a city where it is extremely easy to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing and awful”
Reviews.Author: Krista_G
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. All previous complains in the reviews are true. The hotel is really tired and worn-down, nothing in it remind me photos on the expedia.com. Simply don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful, unsafe hotel. Do NOT stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Lld-90
Reviews.Content: Where to start! Couldn't really understand the person at the check in desk and we had to have the maid who we also couldn't understand show us to out room. The room was outside of the hotel and down the street and was a small door located between two restaurants. When we finally got through the door after the confusion with the keys we were met by a dark hallway and flight of stairs, wires hanging round, tacky carpets, lights with no covers and rubbish including air rifle targets by the fire escape. The room was small very basic. Plug sockets hanging off the wall, holes in the wall, the floor wasn't level and the bathroom door didn't fit the door frame so was very hard to shut needing a big pull. When closed there was a large gap under the door where the floor wasnt level. Bathroom tiles coming off the wall and the light literally hanging on by a wire. The water from having a shower didn't even go down the plug so made a large pool at your feet which was still there in the morning. There was no fire escape information which I thought was something all rooms had to have. Outside the room was very noisy which wasn't helped by the fact that the balcony doors wouldn't even close properly. We didn't even bother going to the breakfast that was provided as we ddnt want to think what that would be like after the appalling accommodation. A horrible place to stay and we spent as little amount of time in the room as we could!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: Paul M
Reviews.Content: Website photos look nothing like actual hotel.Hotel is tired and dirty.Room had broken fridge/cooker,broken window catch(couldn't close it),cracked toilet seat,mildew on bathroom walls/ceiling,shower curtain and a broken live plug socket.Big pile of laundry bags stacked outside our door and drink bottles left on stairway.?Tea and coffee provided but no kettle! Breakfast was DIY cornflakes,toast, tea and coffee plus a plate of waxy sliced cheese and a bowl of boiled eggs.The location was noisy(You can hear the tube trains going under the hotel),but convenient for station.Pretty courtyard at rear of hotel but cobbled road was noisy. Having said that the beds were clean and ok. I would not recommend this hotel.If we hadn't arrived late we'd have gone elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting!”
Reviews.Author: Peta28
Reviews.Content: Loved the proximity to Paddington Station. Was a bit worried when I first got there but if you pile on the smiles the staff come around in the end! My room was quirky...yes.. in desperate need of some refurbishing...yes, but it was clean. The breakfast was boring but if your on a budget and don't mind having somewhere simple to doss your head then its alright!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: waltersgreg
Reviews.Content: I booked the room before I read the reviews and was scared for what I would find when I got there. To my surprise and delight, the hotel was no where near as bad as the reviews. I actually really enjoyed it! I had stayed the night before in a Marriott and it was definitely not that but I found it charming. My room was a single with 2 twin beds, a juliet balcony overlooking the street and a clean bathroom. The hotel may need some work but I enjoyed my 2 nights there. It was in a great location and an excellent deal for the money. I also felt very secure there. The lift did work. The staff was very friendly too. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I being Generous!”
Reviews.Author: godsmack44
Reviews.Content: The Ascot was a A-Typical cheap London hotel. Has a great location, adjacent to Paddington Station. The rooms, while small, were not the smallest I've ever stayed in, while in London. The furnishings were dated, the carpets worn and the breakfast was adequate. The front desk staff were beyond rude and completely incompetent with any task given to them. The ONLY thing that saved this whole review was.....THEY HAD A WORKING ELEVATOR! If you want a cheap hotel and can handle rude, incompetent staff..then the Ascot is the Hotel for you!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Miles L
Reviews.Content: The hotel advertised looked quite nice. When you get there your in for a different story altogether! The hotel looks noting like what is advertised! The staff in the reception were rude and ignorant. We booked a double and were given a twin where they had pushed the beds together. The wall paper was peeling, the furniture was damaged. Everything just felt really dirty. The telly had 1 channel that didn't have a clear picture. We had a kettle and some tea bags, but no cups, just 2 glasses??( they didnt even match) The only good thing about the room was that we had clean bedding. Breakfast was just a bad. They advertise a continental breakfast but all you are offered is either toast or cornflakes which you have to sort out yourself. When we checked out the guy on the reception didnt even say thank you. He just took our key and carried on looking at his computer! We wont be staying here again! And we don't recommend it to anyone either!

Reviews.Title: “Worst place we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: alisonjordan186370
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing like it was described on the internet. It is lacking in everything. Very poor decor, my daughter's door would not open, and our bathroom sink was held up by a peice of wood! The tea and coffee facility had no spooons and the shower curtain was as brown as the inside of a teapot. We left without using the shower, and without the breakfast. I couldn't bear my family to stay there a minute longer than was necessary! The staff were uncommunicative and unhelpful. I would have preferred to have left without staying the night, but that wasn't possible, so we left as soon as we could the next morning. The only good thing about it was that it was near to Hyde Park, but I would rather have paid a lot more money and not had to worry about staying there.

Reviews.Title: “wtf! do not stop in this "hotel" room 201”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieNS
Reviews.Content: Before I start I would like to point out that we booked this in May and very stupidly did not look on trip advisor which we normally do, our friends had booked the hotel as it was close to Hyde Park for Proms in the park so we booked too - paid £156 including breakfast for 2 nights non refundable, if we could have walked away without paying the £156 we would have! Positive points - spotless crisp white towels & linen on bed. Great view of Mews outside (back of "hotel"). Close to Hyde Park. Had breakfast next door in the cafe - not in the "hotel", not a bad breakfast at all, just tell them you are staying next door and your room number. Negative - Room -where do i start! a)Throw on bed dirty. b) One curtain for the dirty cracked window, curtain just barely hanging onto rail, smelt awful like old smoke and as the bed was positioned under the window all you smelt was that! c)Lino on floor cracked,floor very creaky felt sorry for room below! d)Bed very old (dare not look at the mattress) base and mattress creaky and very very lumpy! e) White goods in bathroom were clean but mould in grout, and no plugs for bath or basin - had to run shower for 10 mins for hot water (good pressure though). Hardly any water out of the sink taps.Water marks on ceiling from upstairs room. f) Room small, had about 6inches to get out of the bed on one side! g) Room 201 looked like it had just been painted or should I say the walls looked ok! 2. Hotel itself a) outside - mmmm seen better hostels looks dirty! b) Inside reception area small. c) Lift carries max 3 people d) Carpets threadbear e) "Hotel" inside walls were chipping & dirty. f) A complete maize of corridors, god help them if they have a fire! Even the outside fire escape was blocked! How it passes it's fire inspection I do not know. Our friends had a worse time in their room on the 3rd floor, no water, no electric, dirty carpet, even smaller room than ours,shower head had to be hand held as the fixtures were broken, sink taps broken./not working correctly, bed just as bad as ours. The reception staff said they would sort out everything but nothing was done, it seemed all they wanted to do was get the money for the room up front then sod the consequences! If any London councillers read this then this place needs shutting down it is a disgrace, i have travelled to so many poorer nations than london and stayed where there hasn't been much money (i.e an over night trip from a main holiday) but the rooms have been far more superior than what this place has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: timmy71
Reviews.Content: The door could not lock and would have opened of you hit it hard as it was not closing properly. As soon as you open the water basin the water that drains comes out into the bath from the drain of the bath. Very unhygienic. When I noted these to the reception they said they would take care of them but did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!”
Reviews.Author: lovemygreens
Reviews.Content: Worst 'hotel' ever. Was given a broom cupboard to stay in. The door barely closed and it felt soo unsafe. The carpet was filthy, looks to have never been cleaned, ever. The shower door had a piece of glass missing (seriously!!) and there were cobwebs everywhere. Cannot believe this is classified as a hotel! I wouldn't let my dog stay in it, honestly, a kennel would be cleaner! Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Dude this is incredible”
Reviews.Author: BBChef
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have stayed in ever. Incredible, they prep their food in the games room and the person before me left a log in the toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Taken Care Of...”
Reviews.Author: bathory79
Reviews.Content: As a group of three girls travelling alone, some hotels can be judgemental or sleazy towards you, however the staff in the hotel showed genuine concern for our well-being, something which meant we felt sad to hand the key back this morning. Even the other guests were pleasant to us at the breakfast table, it was such a nice environment. The room WAS basic but so was the rate for a London hotel!!! Hairdryer, kettle, shower and toilet worked perfectly, rooms were clean and smelled fresh. The location was central, and the road well known, so finding it was so easy, even after a few drinks! The shops around the hotel are the kind of cheesy things you'd expect in London, but anything you wanted was literally on your doorstep! Also the morning coffee was the best i'd tasted and well needed! I feel that the other reviews of this hotel are quite unfair. It is NOT dirty, it is not expensive, the photographs on the website ARE of the actual rooms (sorry there was no vase of flowers!) and most of all the staff are wonderful and not a word should be said against them. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, and will be staying there again thanks to the welcome I got, well done Ascot Hyde Park Hotel, see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “Big, big mistake booking this hotel”
Reviews.Author: samcro77
Reviews.Content: This hotel was dirty, old and outdated. The hotel itself was not at all looked after. The rooms are small, dark and dingy. They are not cleaned, there were black bits in the beds and mattresses were stained. There wasn't even a bin in the room. The bathroom was filthy with mould everywhere. The toilet seat was broken, there was no toilet roll holders. The taps were broken and the shower was unusable. There were holes in the walls, the doors didnt lock properly and there were exposed wires. There were no bedside tables and you could not get to the window. Staff were rude. We were told breakfast was between 8 and 10 in the basement. we went downstairs at 8 to find boxes of food stacked up everywhere which we had to battle to get past only to be told we were too early and to wait outside the room. only to then be called in 1 minute later????? I will never stay here again and hope no one else does either. Pay a little extra and stay somewhere nicer!

Reviews.Title: “REVIEWS are true. DON'T BOOK this hotel”
Reviews.Author: matrixamp
Reviews.Content: We stood there for our first trip to London last 8 to 12 June 2011, and i hoped i had read the reviews. But last year i've read the reviews about our hotel in Maiorca and they weren't true, completly wrong. So could be the same this year, but NO! The reviews for this hotel are true. The floor is made of wood it makes noises everywhere. Our room was 2x2mts. And had to move the bed to put the suitcase in the closet. But that wasn't the worst. The carpet floor is grey, completly dirty. The blanket on the bed has lots of spot of fat. I cant find enough words in english to define this. HORRIBLE. The worst hotel i've stayed in my life, and i travel a lot in Portugal and Spain. The people are bad. The breakfeast paid in advance is more expensive then the ones outside the hotel. They charged me £4,5 per person and outside about £3,80 and put less food in my plate than the persons seated next to me that weren't in the hotel. One thing is certain it's well comunicated: 3m from Paddington underground, store and several markest in a 1 to 5 minutes walk. Will never, ever stay there again. for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, dirty and noisy room, rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Andrelim
Reviews.Content: The only redeeming point of this hotel that I can think of will be its location. Located within a stone's throw from Paddington station, with good connections to the London Underground and National Rail. The reception was extremely rude and gave us the impression that he simply could not be bothered with us, we stayed there for 2 separate nights and on both nights, we got our room types assigned wrongly. On the first night, we had room 100, which was right next to the lift, in fact, the lift well was in our room. This made the room extremely tiny. To make matters worse, the doors and walls are extremely thin, and when people got into the lift of walked up the stairs, we could hear them moving and parts of the conversation. The second night was marginally better and we got a slightly bigger room. Although as with the first night, the reception got our room type wrong again and both rooms were extremely poorly lit. Come to think bout it, it was better not to look into those dark corners. There was no fridge in the room, and the sink and bathtub both did not come with stoppers. The sheets had stains that I shudder to think what made them and the blankets felt like they had not been washed for awhile. All in all, if you are just looking for a place to sleep, there are better and cheaper options elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Save a bit less, but stay in a better place than this one”
Reviews.Author: AndreyHenke
Reviews.Content: My experience was not good. I went for Eastern holiday with my girlfriend. We had heavy luggage and they have offered the room in the 7th floor. No elevator. No help with the luggage. The rooms were in the other building, not the same as the reception. The staff was not polite. The Wi-Fi was charged and did not function. (they gave the money back but did not make any effort to fix it). I´ve had the worst shower ever. Too difficult to turn it on (electric shower) and when was turned on (after 15min trying) was so hard to get a good temperature. The room had a kitchen. That kitchen was not supposed to be there. The kitchen was adapted to become a room. That made the room so tight. We had a good surprise when they let us leave our luggage there after check out without any charging. The only good thing about the place is the location.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Guern1
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks tired and old from the outside and no better on the inside. The room had been cleaned, but carpets were stained the walls hadn't been painted for a very long time and the general decoration was outdated and the bedding, although, clean was also old. The staff weren't rude, but weren't welcoming either, offering no help with luggage and little direction to the room. Breakfast is stated as continental, but consists of toast, drinks, and a boiled egg! There is no double glazing, so if you're a light sleeper, the sounds from the busy street would keep you awake. The pictures on the booking websites bare no relation the the actual hotel. This place is in dire need of new owners and a complete overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “All the previous reviews are spot-on, I wish I had read them before I booked.”
Reviews.Author: kmercer2509
Reviews.Content: I booked a triple room for myself, husband and teenage son to visit London over the Royal Wedding Bank Holiday. The only thing going for this 'hotel' is the location. I booked it thinking it doesnt matter if its not posh, just clean and tidy, a bed for the night really - but it really was awful. Our room was on the 5th floor, there was a tiny ancient lift that went up to the 4th, then you had to walk up to the 5th. At this point I kind of knew how bad it was, carpets were threadbare, paint peeling off the walls, bannisters coming away etc. The room was cramped but looked tidy, beds made etc. There was a tiny portable tv but no remote control so that was useless. The bathroom was very dated, cracked tiles and when we showered the mixer tap came off in our hand and then we couldnt turn the water off. We had to tell reception, then go out leaving the tap running full on. There was tea/coffee in the room but I didnt even touch it, was so grubby. Breakfast next morning was so bad, we went to the cafe next door to get a decent hot drink. Breakfast was served in the tiny bar area in the cellar and it was help yourself, trays of mugs, every one of which had at least 3 chips. Breakfast consisted of toast, cheese & hard boiled eggs. I did have a dry slice of toast & 2 eggs (making the mistake of 'if I've paid for it, I'm having it) but I really regret that as later on that day I went down with what I think was food poisoning that then wiped out the next 2 days and really spoilt my trip. I cant be sure it was what I ate at the Ascot but I'd bet money on it..... All in all, even at £80 per night it was dire - please be warned.

Reviews.Title: “terrible, do not book !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: helend24
Reviews.Content: very dirty hotel, old furniture doesnt cost any money to stay there... terrible hotel, breakfast e.t.g. only location is good, close to buss station and tube staff are frendly

Reviews.Title: “better go to hostel, then stay in ascot!!!”
Reviews.Author: ivobul
Reviews.Content: Dirty, noisy, uncomfortable. The staff is "clever" and friendly. there is a "lovely" pakistanian or indian music at breafast, the food is vegeterian(no meat) at all. P.S. DO NOT GO THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “There are no words to describe how dire this hotel is...”
Reviews.Author: ejjohnston1986
Reviews.Content: This hotel is shocking at best. I stayed for a three day weekend with a friend, we arrived at about 1:00pm, to be told our room wasn't ready and we would have to wait until 2:00pm, so we checked in and payed our balance to the member of staff at the reception desk and went to get some lunch. We returned at about 1:45pm, the same lady who had taken our money was sitting at the reception desk, but didn't seem to recognise us or recall that we had been there less than an hour before, or that we had already payed the money we owed on our bill. We were then told our room was in a seperate building and were led by the cleaning staff to a building next door, we were then told that our room was "Up, up, up." by the cleaning staff who promptly walked away. My friend and I then began the long trek up eight flights of stairs, which were precarious at best, to the top floor, with many obstacles such as, electric fuse boxes jutting out from the walls on staircase, my friend and I almost dislocating our shoulders on these on numerous occassions during our stay. The hallways weren't particularly clean or well maintained, the room numbers were no more than strips of ripped up paper with numbers written on them, taped to the doors. We arrived in our room, which had a double and a single bed in, both uncomfortable and well past their best, in order to move around the room we had to scramble over the beds as there was no room for movement. There was a kettle in the room and one teacup, despite there being two guests, and four drinking glasses, two of which looked like they hadn't been washed for at least a few months. I should say that towels were provided and the bathroom was clean, more than likely due to the fact there was no warm water. The shower was icy cold, and the water pressure was like having a small child pour a jug of water over your head slowly, even if we did have warm water to have a shower it would probably have taken most of the day. The heating in our room was also not working, and it was the middle of London, in November, with snow beginning to fall, and the blankets (one thin sheet and one thin blanket) on the beds left a lot to be desired; my friend and I did go to reception on the second day of our trip to inform the staff that the heating wasn't working and to ask if it was possible to get some extra blankets for the night, but we were only given the blunt, sarcastic and insincere reply of "The heating's being fixed, they're coming to replace a fuse!" As you may expect, the heating was never getting fixed, at least not in the last two days of mine and my friend's stay. Overall I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, including thew nice Australian couple who were stood outside as my friend and I were leaving to ask if it was worth checking in, we didn't hesitate to advise them to go to anywhere else, well within earshot of the reception desk. For three days, we had no heating, no warm water, no shower and we had to wear our clothes to bed, which we then had to wear throughout the day as well and the staff were just rude and unhelpful. The only positive aspect of this hotel is the location, it's right across the road from Paddington tube station, but I would have rather stayed further away if I could have had a warm night and a shower.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK HERE!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: taylorandrew20
Reviews.Content: This place is an absolute joke and we knew on arrival we had made a big mistake. The reception is an untidy cluttered desk area, on finally arriving at our room ( the lift only goes 1 floor) we found it to a very poor standard. No catch on the window, No plug in the sink, A smelly mouldy shower curtain, and the tv is on a bracket ten feet up the wall! We without question gave the continental breakfast a wide berth and instead ate elsewhere in London. Save your money and choose somewhere other than this place!!

Reviews.Title: “How can they charge good money for this 'All Expenses spared' hovel?”
Reviews.Author: Batsinthecave
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend booked our weekend without using tripadvisor.com - first mistake!! The pics and location looked good and the name of the hotel sounds very grand.... Well, on entering reception we knew we were in trouble. Boxes everywhere, tatty walls and carpet and a lift out of the dark ages. Receptionist constantly on personal phone calls. We were told we were lucky with our room as 'at least you have the lift' - the other building doesn't get that luxury apparently! The room was small, dingy and all-expenses spared. Handles hanging off cupboards and draws, no stool at the 'dressing table', no milk for the coffee on day 2, bathroom door stuck on the floor, mouldy shower curtain which we dismantled and turned to face out for our own well-being. Tap came off in our hands, no plughole, paint on the wallpaper, light bulbs missing - need I go on?? We didn't even entertain the notion of 'continential breakfast' served on the pool table in the basement. Boyfriend has stayed in a lot of hotels whilst working and this is his worst ever. This kind of place lets London down. Avoid at all costs. We spent 2 hours looking for alternative accommodation but everywhere else was fully booked (and many for the same money looked loads better).

Reviews.Title: “old and dirty hotel, only for desperate people”
Reviews.Author: tastuo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very bad contition, dirty carpets, very small rooms, broken stuff in toilet and an ungly space for breakfast without heating. More site photos display an other hotel maby. There was a very small lobby beside to the front desk without chairs. Location was good near by underground station.

Reviews.Title: “I felt deceided”
Reviews.Author: mortis31
Reviews.Content: The condition of the hotel was terrible and gave me the sense of complete abandonement. The personel was indiferrent, the breakfast room was on the basement and there was no heating there. The rooms, besides the bad condition of the walls, windows etc, had no space to move. Finally, to be fair, the beds and tha bathroom were clean but this is not enough for a 3star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “this "hotel" should not even be ranked”
Reviews.Author: sheekobeeko
Reviews.Content: worst hotel i have EVER seen. i would not even take a dump there. i dont know how it is still runs. it breaks all health and safety regulations. I can't beleive i lasted 4 nights there. the staff dont want to deal with you or anyone. breakfast is a joke. blowing up this hotel (with the staff inside) would be doing it a favour.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here, never beleive them!”
Reviews.Author: twentypages
Reviews.Content: This hotel is NOTHING like its website. It is not clean, does not have the facilities it promotes (i.e. no wireless in our room, no telephone in the room, no lift in the part we stayed in,.........) The shower was broken, the floors dirty......... the breakfast was served on the pool table in the underground bar. Our friend was to stay there too, and as she is a wheelchair user emialed and rang to make sure tehy were accessible. They confirmed tehy are - but that is not true at all. Stairs evereywhere and no accessible rooms. So she was left stranded in london with no accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: JenniKoivumaki
Reviews.Content: Our group arrived to Ascot at 9 p.m. We we tired and wanted to go to the rooms rightaway. We had booked 3 rooms, but they didn't have 3 rooms for us. Peter, who was in the reception, was very unfriendly. He called a taxi for two of us and they had to go to another hotel for one night! We still (we didn't have all of our rooms) had to pay our stay rightaway but Peter couldn't give me a receipt! He told me that he will get it to me at the same night but I had to ask for it three times until I got it! The rooms (quarter-room and room for two) were small and quite dirty. The shower was ok. The breakfast was in the basement and the room was very small. The staff was very unfriendly, they didn't even say Good morning or anything, they didn't even smile!!! Breakfast was basic and the same every day (we stayed there 4 days). There was cheese, jams, eggs, toast, cornflakes, orangejuice (from plastic mugs?!) and coffee... One morning some boy took orangejuice to a coffeemug and then the staff told to the boy that you can't get the juice to the mug so he had to change the juice to a plastic mug! There was not any service in the hotel!!! And the reception was terrible. Their websites pictures doesn't match to the hotel! Horrible place!

Reviews.Title: “O.K.”
Reviews.Author: twist27
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews before I booked and was expecting the worst but all I needed was a hotel near to Paddington station for one night. The room was small, basic and the decor was a bit shabby but it was clean and the bed was comfortable. There was a small wardrobe, television, hairdryer and you could make tea and coffee. The bathroom’s decor was also a bit shabby but was clean and the shower was fine although the hot water had to be run for a couple of minutes to warm up. The staff were friendly and helpful. I didn’t eat breakfast as I wanted something more substantial so I can not comment on it. If you intend spending a lot of time in your hotel room this isn’t the hotel I would choose but if all you need is a bed and shower for the night then for under £50 in central London this hotel is ok.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Garyndor
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in and the chap at reception didn't end his mobile phone conversation while he gave us our key we knew we were in for an 'interesting' stay. He didn't even tell us which way to go to our rooms. The room was too small for the two beds that were squashed into it., the furniture was really shabby, with torn fabric on the beds, and it was desperately in need of decoration. The bathroom was clean. We didn't dare to venture down into the basement for breakfast, so we went to Garfunkel's across the road. This is without question the worst hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Budget stay and good night's sleep”
Reviews.Author: heth0911
Reviews.Content: it was clean but tatty but we overlooked that as it wasn't expensive. staff were friendly & helpful. breakfast was a bit irritating because the room was small & there weren't enough tables & chairs to go around. The continental breakfast was perfectly fine though. if you leave your luggage they charge you, we left a suitcase and was charged £5. don't know if that is reasonable for london or not? we'd recommend it for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful, and breakfast in the basement, disgusting!!”
Reviews.Author: SueyG
Reviews.Content: "We were absolutely disgusted at paying £230 for a family room which had a double bed and 2 singles bed crammed into a small space. Ugly polyfiller filling cracks in walls and then left. Bathroom needed a revamp, cracked tiles but worst of all no hot water when we woke in the morning and to cap it all we were unable to fill the sink for a wash by using kettle water because there was no plug to put into the sink. We did not stay in the room for longer than we had to. Plus broken window which had to be wedged open all night, if we had children that were not sensible they could have climbed on the side and jumped out of the window which was on the 4th floor. Reception was the smallest reception you have every seen and they wanted to charge us to keep our bags in the day whilst we went site seeing....I can not stop complaining, I'm sure I have probably forgot something. Oh yes and breakfast, our younger members of the party would not eat breakfast, they just had a cup of warm orange juice. Final note: I would not recommend visiting this hotel.."

Reviews.Title: “VILE”
Reviews.Author: visitorBirmingham
Reviews.Content: Room needed decorating, walls were stripped of wallpaper and dirty, the chest of drawers was stripped of varnish, one cup was cracked beyond repair, one drinking glass was broken at the rim. There was no hot water, no plug in the sink, no water pressure anyway, water just went down the hole in the sink. Great big hole in the bathroom door. A no smoking hotel which very clearly smelled of cigarette smoke everywhere. Window opened straight out on to the fire escape. One bed was very sqeaky. Breakfast area too small for the amount of guests, people were eating standing up, tables not cleared away quickly. Very noisy until small hours.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stai here”
Reviews.Author: piril
Reviews.Content: This hotel need a make over, animals in the room , old beeds ,no telli thas woorks , no sitings for breakfast me and my kids ware eating on the legs , dont stay here for normenn ikke bo her the staff in the hotel promise things the dont hold photos on internett are old and some one have made a macover on them

HotelInfo.Name: ascot hyde park hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 11 craven road, London, England
